___obj_activity.description: The activity of the obj Agent that is affected, e.g., its 'kinase' activity.

___subj.description: The agent responsible for the change in activity, i.e., the 'upstream' node.

___obj.description: The agent whose activity is influenced by the subject, i.e., the 'downstream' node.

$eref.description: Regulation of activity (such as activation and inhibition)

___enz.description: The enzyme involved in the modification.

___residue.description: The amino acid residue being modified, or None if it is unknown or unspecified.

___position.description: The position of the modified amino acid, or None if it is unknown or unspecified.

$eref.description: Statement representing the modification of a protein.

___enz.description: The enzyme involved in the modification.

___residue.description: The amino acid residue being modified, or None if it is unknown or unspecified.

___position.description: The position of the modified amino acid, or None if it is unknown or unspecified.

$eref.description: Statement representing the self-modification of a protein.

___agent.description: The Agent in a particular active or inactive state. The sets of ModConditions, BoundConditions, and MutConditions on the given Agent instance indicate the relevant conditions.

___activity.description: The type of activity influenced by the given set of conditions, e.g., 'kinase'.

___is_active.description: Whether the conditions are activating (True) or inactivating (False).

$eref.description: Specifies conditions causing an Agent to be active or inactive. Types of conditions influencing a specific type of biochemical activity can include modifications, bound Agents, and mutations.
Exchange of GTP for GDP on a small GTPase protein mediated by a GEF. Represents the generic process by which a guanosine exchange factor (GEF) catalyzes nucleotide exchange on a GTPase protein.

Acceleration of a GTPase protein's GTP hydrolysis rate by a GAP. Represents the generic process by which a GTPase activating protein (GAP) catalyzes GTP hydrolysis by a particular small GTPase protein.
A set of proteins observed to be in a complex.
A set of unordered concepts that are associated with each other.

___from_location.description: The location from which the agent translocates. This must be a valid GO cellular component name (e.g. 'cytoplasm') or ID (e.g. 'GO:0005737').

___to_location.description: The location to which the agent translocates. This must be a valid GO cellular component name or ID.

$eref.description: The translocation of a molecular agent from one location to another.
Represents directed, two-element interactions.

___subj.description: The event which acts as the influencer.

___obj.description: The event which acts as the influencee

$eref.description: A causal influence between two events.

___obj_from.description: The list of molecular species being consumed by the conversion.

___obj_to.description: The list of molecular species being created by the conversion.

$eref.description: Conversion of molecular species mediated by a controller protein.

___delta.description: A dictionary specifying the polarity and adjactives of change in concept.

___concept.description: The concept which the event happens to.

___context.description: The context associated with the event

$eref.description: An event over a concept of interest.

_88Evidence.description: Container for evidence supporting a given statement.

___text.description: Natural language text supporting the statement.

___epistemics.description: A dictionary describing various forms of epistemic certainty associated with the statement.

___annotations.description: Dictionary containing additional information on the context of the statement, e.g., species, cell line, tissue type, etc. The entries may vary depending on the source of the information.

___source_api.description: String identifying the INDRA API used to capture the statement, e.g., 'trips', 'biopax', 'bel'.

___pmid.description: String indicating the Pubmed ID of the source of the statement.

___source_id.description: For statements drawn from databases, ID of the database entity corresponding to the statement.

$eref.description: All statement types, below, may have these fields and 'inherit' from this schema

___delta.description: A dictionary specifying the polarity and adjactives of change in concept.

$eref.description: A concept/entity of interest that is the argument of a Statement

___name.description: The name of the concept, possibly a canonicalized name.

___db_refs.description: Dictionary of database identifiers associated with this concept.

___concept.description: The concept which the event happens to.

$eref.description: The context in which a given Statement was reported.

___type.description: Either 'world' or 'bio', depending on the type of context being repersented.

___context.description: The context associated with the event

_88Event.description: An event over a concept of interest.

_88ModCondition.description: Mutation state of an amino acid position of an Agent.

___is_modified.description: Specifies whether the modification is present or absent. Setting the flag specifies that the Agent with the ModCondition is unmodified at the site.

___residue.description: String indicating the modified amino acid, e.g., 'Y' or 'tyrosine'. If None, indicates that the residue at the modification site is unknown or unspecified.

___mod_type.description: The type of post-translational modification, e.g., 'phosphorylation'. Valid modification types currently include: 'phosphorylation', 'ubiquitination', 'sumoylation', 'hydroxylation', and 'acetylation'. If an invalid modification type is passed an InvalidModTypeError is raised.

___position.description: String indicating the position of the modified amino acid, e.g., '202'. If None, indicates that the position is unknown or unspecified.

$eref.description: All statement types, below, may have these fields and 'inherit' from this schema
